Package com.dampcake.bencode

Class BencodeOutputStream

java.lang.Object
java.io.OutputStream
java.io.FilterOutputStream
com.dampcake.bencode.BencodeOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
public class BencodeOutputStream extends FilterOutputStream
OutputStream for writing bencoded data.
Author:
Adam Peck

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    BencodeOutputStream(OutputStream out)
    Creates a new BencodeOutputStream that writes to the OutputStream passed and uses UTF-8 Charset for encoding the data.
    BencodeOutputStream(OutputStream out, Charset charset)
    Creates a new BencodeOutputStream that writes to the OutputStream passed and uses the Charset passed for encoding the data.

    • BencodeOutputStream

      public BencodeOutputStream(OutputStream out, Charset charset)
      Creates a new BencodeOutputStream that writes to the OutputStream passed and uses the Charset passed for encoding the data.
      Parameters:
      out - the OutputStream to write to
      charset - the Charset to use
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the Charset passed is null

      Creates a new BencodeOutputStream that writes to the OutputStream passed and uses UTF-8 Charset for encoding the data.
      Parameters:

      Writes the passed byte[] to the stream.

      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the byte[] is null
      IOException - if the underlying stream throws
      Since:
      1.4.1

    • writeNumber

      public void writeNumber(Number n) throws IOException
      Writes the passed Number to the stream.

      The number is converted to a Long, meaning any precision is lost as it not supported by the bencode spec.

      Parameters:
      n - the Number to write to the stream
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the Number is null
      IOException - if the underlying stream throws

    • writeList

      public void writeList(Iterable<?> l) throws IOException
      Writes the passed Iterable to the stream.

      Data contained in the Iterable is written as the correct type. Any Iterable is written as a List, any Number as a Number, any Map as a Dictionary and any other Object is written as a String calling the Object.toString() method.

      Parameters:
      l - the Iterable to write to the stream
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the Iterable is null
      IOException - if the underlying stream throws

    • writeDictionary

      public void writeDictionary(Map<?,?> m) throws IOException
      Writes the passed Map to the stream.

      Data contained in the Map is written as the correct type. Any Iterable is written as a List, any Number as a Number, any Map as a Dictionary and any other Object is written as a String calling the Object.toString() method.

      Parameters:
      m - the Map to write to the stream
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the Map is null
      IOException - if the underlying stream throws
